content: The content in the course is interesting and valuable but there is a lack of reinforced learning. The presenter often shows an example, followed by an improved version but chooses not to keep both on screen together, making it difficult to compare the differences. The presenter also does not seemed to have planned out what he will say beyond the key points he wants to hit on. This leads to hearing the phrase "you know" a lot, but also creates inflated explanations that - again - could be supported with visual cues or by repeating terminology and rules that he wants the audience to remember.  Compared to content one might find on Lynda.com for instance, the course is not as carefully scripted. However, I am mindful that the quality of my writing - as it appears in this review - is far better after taking just half of the course. It is important to note that engaging with the exercises has improved results for me.

Shani is very clear in his presentation and gives a lot of tips to improve your professional writing skills. The course is not presented in a highly graphic way, but it worked for me as I learn best by listening and putting stuff into practice. Thanks Shani!
